result.execSummary:
The defendant Renae A Richardson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Joint/Several with:
Stephen Schultz, Rusk County Case #15CM108
Scott M Rathbun, Rusk County Case #15CM111

DE will comply with all standard AODA provisions

Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores.

 Defendant is not to possess or consume any medications not prescribed by a physician. 
 All prescribed medications must remain in the original container and be taken only as prescribed.

Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.
DE will have approval of DOC agent if employed in a bar setting.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Renae A Richardson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: DE has indicated undecided at this time about seeking PCR.  (filed in 15CF120)

Defendant Renae A Richardson in court with attorney Erika Caroline Bahnson.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CM102, 15CM109.  Agreement has been reached in these matters.  Atty Bahnson recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  

15CF120-amend Ct 1, DE enters a plea of NC,
                 Ct 2-DRI
15CM102-NC
15CM109-NC- Court will accept all and find the DE guilty.  Court will accept the recommendations of the parties.  Court will order 18 month probation, DE will complete an AODA/Drug assessment, no alcohol possession or consumption, no bars, taverns or liquor stores, no illicit substances, DE will pay restitition of $150.00 J/S with co-defendant, will pay CC, DNA sample and surcharge.  DE must have approval of DOC agent if employed in a bar.
DE has indicated undecided at this time about seeking PCR.  (filed in 15CF120)
It is ordered that the evidence seized in this matter can be photographed by law enforcement and then returned to the appropriate individual(s).  Photographs will be used at trial if needed.

Defendant Renae A Richardson in court with attorney Annette M Barna.  James D Babbitt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CM102, 15CM109.  Atty has conflict, schedule Adj Init App for 8-25-15 @ 2:00PM with Atty Bahnson.  Bond continues in all cases.
